properties: P.F1.1.1:Validation Required[spec: âˆ€i âˆˆ Input: store(i) â‡’ validator(i) = Valid No invalid input reaches storage, format: latex] | P.F1.1.2:Normalization[spec: âˆ€v âˆˆ Valid: normalizer(v) produces consistent Internal format, format: latex] | P.F1.1.3:Persistence[spec: âˆ€i âˆˆ Internal: store(i) â‡’ retrievable(i), format: latex]

operations: Stream[sig: stream(source: Source) â†’ Effect, def: $stream(source: Source) â†’ Effect = for event in source.events(): buffer.enqueue(event) if buffer.full(): apply_backpressure() process_next()$, format: latex] | Process[sig: process(event: Event) â†’ ProcessedEvent, def: $process(event: Event) â†’ ProcessedEvent = validated := validate(event) enriched := enrich(validated) return enriched$, format: latex] | Emit[sig: emit(event: ProcessedEvent) â†’ Effect, def: $emit(event: ProcessedEvent) â†’ Effect = for subscriber in subscribers: subscriber.callback(event)$, format: latex]

components: stages[type: SequenceâŸ¨StageâŸ©, notation: stages, desc: transformation stages] | ir[type: SequenceâŸ¨IRâŸ©, notation: ir, desc: intermediate representations] | error\_handler[type: Error â†’ Recovery, notation: error\_handler, desc: handles stage failures] | compose[type: SequenceâŸ¨StageâŸ© â†’ (Input â†’ Output), notation: compose, desc: composes stages]
type_definitions: Stage[def: (name: String, transform: Input â†’ Output | Error), format: latex] | IR[def: Intermediate representation between stages, format: latex] | Recovery[def: Retry | Skip | Abort | Fallback, format: latex]
properties: P.F2.1.1:Sequential Composition[spec: output(stage_n) = input(stage_{n+1}) Stages connect sequentially, format: latex] | P.F2.1.2:Error Propagation[spec: error(stage_i) â‡’ handle_error âˆ¨ abort_pipeline, format: latex] | P.F2.1.3:Determinism[spec: âˆ€input: compose(stages)(input) produces same output, format: latex]
operations: Execute Pipeline[sig: execute(input: Input) â†’ Output | Error, def: $execute(input: Input) â†’ Output | Error = result := input for stage in stages: result := stage.transform(result) if is_error(result): result := error_handler(result) if abort(result): return result return result$, format: latex] | Compose Stages[sig: compose(stages: SequenceâŸ¨StageâŸ©) â†’ (Input â†’ Output), def: $compose(stages: SequenceâŸ¨StageâŸ©) â†’ (Input â†’ Output) = Î» input: fold(stages, input, Î»(acc, stage): stage(acc))$, format: latex] | Handle Error[sig: handle_error(error: Error, stage: Stage) â†’ Recovery, def: $handle_error(error: Error, stage: Stage) â†’ Recovery = case error_type(error) of Transient â†’ Retry(stage, max_attempts=3) Permanent â†’ Abort(error) Recoverable â†’ Fallback(alternative_stage)$, format: latex]
manifestations: Compiler pipelines[source â†’ AST â†’ IR â†’ binary] | Data transformation[ETL pipelines] | Build systems[source â†’ compile â†’ link â†’ package] | Markdown renderers[MD â†’ AST â†’ HTML] | Image processing[raw â†’ decode â†’ transform â†’ encode]

type_definitions: Agent[def: (id: String, capabilities: SetâŸ¨CapabilityâŸ©,, format: latex] | Task[def: (id: String, requirements: SetâŸ¨CapabilityâŸ©,, format: latex] | Result[def: Success(value: Value) | Failure(error: Error), format: latex]
properties: P.F2.2.1:Capability Matching[spec: âˆ€t âˆˆ tasks: coordinator(t) = a â‡’ t.requirements âŠ† a.capabilities, format: latex] | P.F2.2.2:Load Balancing[spec: distribution(agents) should be approximately uniform, format: latex] | P.F2.2.3:Deadline Awareness[spec: âˆ€t âˆˆ tasks: priority(t) considers deadline(t), format: latex]
operations: Orchestrate[sig: orchestrate(tasks: QueueâŸ¨TaskâŸ©) â†’ Effect, def: $orchestrate(tasks: QueueâŸ¨TaskâŸ©) â†’ Effect = while Â¬empty(tasks): task := dequeue_by_priority(tasks) agent := coordinator(task) if agent.busy: re_enqueue(task) else: assign(task, agent)$, format: latex] | Assign Task[sig: assign(task: Task, agent: Agent) â†’ Effect, def: $assign(task: Task, agent: Agent) â†’ Effect = agent.busy := true result := agent.execute(task) results[task] := result agent.busy := false notify_completion(task, result)$, format: latex] | Select Agent[sig: select_agent(task: Task) â†’ Agent, def: $select_agent(task: Task) â†’ Agent = available := {a âˆˆ agents : Â¬a.busy âˆ§ task.requirements âŠ† a.capabilities} if empty(available): return null return argmin(a âˆˆ available, load(a))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Multi-agent AI systems | Task distribution in distributed systems | Worker pool management | Microservice orchestration | Parallel computation frameworks

type_definitions: Node[def: (id: String, compute: Inputs â†’ Output, dependencies: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©), format: latex] | Dependency[def: (source: Node, target: Node), format: latex]
properties: P.F2.3.1:Minimal Recomputation[spec: âˆ€n âˆˆ graph: recompute(n) â‡” (invalidated(n) âˆ¨ âˆƒd âˆˆ dependencies(n): invalidated(d)) Only recompute what changed, format: latex] | P.F2.3.2:Topological Order[spec: âˆ€nâ‚, nâ‚‚: dependency(nâ‚, nâ‚‚) â‡’ compute_order(nâ‚) < compute_order(nâ‚‚), format: latex] | P.F2.3.3:Cache Consistency[spec: âˆ€n âˆˆ graph: cache[n] = last_computed_value(n) âˆ¨ cache[n] = âŠ¥, format: latex]
operations: Update[sig: update(changed: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©) â†’ Effect, def: $update(changed: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©) â†’ Effect = affected := transitive_dependencies(changed) invalidate(affected) sorted := topological_sort(affected) for node in sorted: cache[node] := recompute(node)$, format: latex] | Invalidate[sig: invalidate(nodes: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©) â†’ SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©, def: $invalidate(nodes: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©) â†’ SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ© = invalidated := nodes for node in nodes: for dependent in dependents(node): invalidated := invalidated âˆª invalidate({dependent}) return invalidated$, format: latex] | Recompute[sig: recompute(node: Node) â†’ Value, def: $recompute(node: Node) â†’ Value = inputs := {cache[d] : d âˆˆ dependencies(node)} return node.compute(inputs)$, format: latex]

components: base[type: BaseData, notation: base, desc: input data to enrich] | enrichers[type: SetâŸ¨EnricherâŸ©, notation: enrichers, desc: enrichment sources] | combine[type: BaseData Ã— SetâŸ¨EnrichmentâŸ© â†’ EnrichedData, notation: combine, desc: merges enrichments] | output[type: EnrichedData, notation: output, desc: enriched result]
type_definitions: BaseData[def: Core data requiring enrichment, format: latex] | Enricher[def: (source: String, enrich: BaseData â†’ Enrichment), format: latex] | Enrichment[def: Additional data from external source, format: latex] | EnrichedData[def: BaseData + aggregated Enrichments, format: latex]
properties: P.F2.4.1:Non-Destructive[spec: âˆ€b âˆˆ BaseData: base_fields(combine(b, enrichments)) = b Original data preserved, format: latex] | P.F2.4.2:Parallel Enrichment[spec: âˆ€eâ‚, eâ‚‚ âˆˆ enrichers: eâ‚ and eâ‚‚ can execute in parallel, format: latex] | P.F2.4.3:Partial Failure Tolerance[spec: failure(enricher_i) â‡ failure(entire_flow) Flow continues with available enrichments, format: latex]
operations: Enrich[sig: enrich(base: BaseData) â†’ EnrichedData, def: $enrich(base: BaseData) â†’ EnrichedData = enrichments := parallel_map(enrichers, Î»e: e.enrich(base)) successful := {e : e âˆˆ enrichments âˆ§ Â¬is_error(e)} return combine(base, successful)$, format: latex] | Fetch Enrichment[sig: fetch(source: Enricher, base: BaseData) â†’ Enrichment | Error, def: $fetch(source: Enricher, base: BaseData) â†’ Enrichment | Error = try: return source.enrich(base) catch timeout: return partial_enrichment(source, base) catch error: return error$, format: latex] | Combine[sig: combine(base: BaseData, enrichments: SetâŸ¨EnrichmentâŸ©) â†’ EnrichedData, def: $combine(base: BaseData, enrichments: SetâŸ¨EnrichmentâŸ©) â†’ EnrichedData = result := base for enrichment in enrichments: result := merge(result, enrichment) return result$, format: latex]
manifestations: Data augmentation[ML training] | Content enrichment[metadata, tags] | Profile enrichment[user data + social + behavior] | Product enrichment[details + reviews + pricing] | Log enrichment[traces + metrics + context]

components: observe[type: Environment â†’ Observations, notation: observe, desc: collects data] | learn[type: Observations â†’ Model, notation: learn, desc: trains or updates model] | update[type: Model â†’ Policy, notation: update, desc: updates decision policy] | apply[type: Policy â†’ Actions, notation: apply, desc: applies learned policy]
type_definitions: Observations[def: SequenceâŸ¨(State, Action, Reward)âŸ©, format: latex] | Model[def: Learned representation of environment, format: latex] | Policy[def: Decision-making strategy, format: latex] | Actions[def: Commands applied to environment, format: latex]
properties: P.F3.1.1:Continuous Improvement[spec: âˆ€t: accuracy(model_t+1) â‰¥ accuracy(model_t) âˆ¨ explore(new_strategy), format: latex] | P.F3.1.2:Feedback Integration[spec: âˆ€observation âˆˆ Observations: observation influences future policy, format: latex] | P.F3.1.3:Convergence[spec: lim_{tâ†’âˆ} improvement(model_t) â†’ 0 Eventually reaches optimal or near-optimal, format: latex]
operations: Execute Loop[sig: loop(environment: Environment) â†’ Effect, def: $loop(environment: Environment) â†’ Effect = observations := [] model := initialize_model() while running: obs := observe(environment) observations := observations + [obs] if should_update(observations): model := learn(observations) policy := update(model) actions := apply(policy, environment)$, format: latex] | Learn[sig: learn(observations: Observations) â†’ Model, def: $learn(observations: Observations) â†’ Model = features := extract_features(observations) model := train(features, current_model) validate(model, validation_set) return model$, format: latex] | Apply[sig: apply(policy: Policy, env: Environment) â†’ Actions, def: $apply(policy: Policy, env: Environment) â†’ Actions = state := env.current_state() action := policy.select_action(state) env.execute(action) return action$, format: latex]
manifestations: Reinforcement learning systems | Recommender systems | Adaptive user interfaces | Auto-tuning systems | Online learning algorithms

components: validate[type: Data â†’ SetâŸ¨ViolationâŸ©, notation: validate, desc: checks constraints] | report[type: Violation â†’ Notification, notation: report, desc: reports issues] | correct[type: Violation â†’ Correction, notation: correct, desc: attempts fixes] | verify[type: Correction â†’ ğ”¹, notation: verify, desc: confirms fix]
type_definitions: Violation[def: (rule: Rule, location: Location, severity: Severity), format: latex] | Rule[def: (id: String, check: Data â†’ ğ”¹, message: String), format: latex] | Correction[def: Automatic(fix: Fix) | Manual(suggestion: String), format: latex] | Severity[def: Error | Warning | Info, format: latex]
properties: P.F3.2.1:Completeness[spec: âˆ€d âˆˆ Data: validate(d) finds all violations according to defined rules, format: latex] | P.F3.2.2:Non-Destructive[spec: âˆ€v âˆˆ Violations: correct(v) preserves valid data, format: latex] | P.F3.2.3:Verification[spec: âˆ€c âˆˆ Corrections: verify(c) â‡’ Â¬violation_exists(after_correction), format: latex]
operations: Execute Validation[sig: execute(data: Data) â†’ Report, def: $execute(data: Data) â†’ Report = violations := validate(data) if empty(violations): return Success else: for v in violations: report(v) if auto_correctable(v): correction := correct(v) if verify(correction): apply(correction)$, format: latex] | Validate[sig: validate(data: Data) â†’ SetâŸ¨ViolationâŸ©, def: $validate(data: Data) â†’ SetâŸ¨ViolationâŸ© = violations := {} for rule in rules: if Â¬rule.check(data): violations := violations âˆª {Violation(rule, location(data), severity(rule))} return violations$, format: latex] | Correct[sig: correct(violation: Violation) â†’ Correction, def: $correct(violation: Violation) â†’ Correction = if has_automatic_fix(violation): return Automatic(generate_fix(violation)) else: return Manual(suggest_fix(violation))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Form validation with corrections | Code linters with auto-fix | Data quality checks | Schema validation | Constraint satisfaction solvers

type_definitions: Metrics[def: MapâŸ¨String, ValueâŸ©, format: latex] | Anomaly[def: (metric: String, threshold: â„, actual: â„, severity: â„•), format: latex] | Adjustment[def: (parameter: String, old_value: Value, new_value: Value), format: latex] | Performance[def: Improvement | Degradation | Neutral, format: latex]
properties: P.F3.3.1:Stability[spec: âˆ€adjustments: system remains stable after applying adjustments No oscillation or divergence, format: latex]

components: track[type: UserAction â†’ Event, notation: track, desc: records user behavior] | infer[type: SequenceâŸ¨EventâŸ© â†’ Preferences, notation: infer, desc: learns preferences] | personalize[type: Preferences â†’ Configuration, notation: personalize, desc: customizes experience] | apply[type: Configuration â†’ Effect, notation: apply, desc: applies personalization]
type_definitions: UserAction[def: Click | View | Purchase | Search | Rate | Configure, format: latex] | Event[def: (user: UserId, action: UserAction, context: Context, timestamp: Time), format: latex] | Preferences[def: MapâŸ¨Feature, ScoreâŸ©, format: latex] | Configuration[def: Personalized settings and content, format: latex]
properties: P.F3.4.1:Privacy Preservation[spec: âˆ€u âˆˆ Users: preferences(u) stored with user consent âˆ§ anonymizable, format: latex] | P.F3.4.2:Preference Decay[spec: âˆ€p âˆˆ Preferences: score(p, t) = score(p, 0) Â· decay_function(t) Old preferences have less weight, format: latex] | P.F3.4.3:Override Capability[spec: âˆ€u âˆˆ Users: explicit_preference(u) overrides inferred_preference(u), format: latex]
operations: Personalize[sig: personalize(user: UserId) â†’ Effect, def: $personalize(user: UserId) â†’ Effect = events := track(user) preferences := infer(events) config := personalize(preferences, user.explicit_settings) apply(config, user.session)$, format: latex] | Infer Preferences[sig: infer(events: SequenceâŸ¨EventâŸ©) â†’ Preferences, def: $infer(events: SequenceâŸ¨EventâŸ©) â†’ Preferences = features := extract_features(events) patterns := find_patterns(features) preferences := {} for (feature, pattern) in patterns: score := calculate_affinity(pattern) preferences[feature] := score return preferences$, format: latex] | Apply Configuration[sig: apply(config: Configuration, session: Session) â†’ Effect, def: $apply(config: Configuration, session: Session) â†’ Effect = for (setting, value) in config: session.set(setting, value) content := filter_by_preferences(available_content, config) session.recommendations := rank(content, config)$, format: latex]
manifestations: Recommendation engines | Adaptive interfaces | Content personalization | Search result ranking | Notification preferences

components: state[type: State, notation: state, desc: current application state] | render[type: State â†’ VirtualDOM, notation: render, desc: creates virtual representation] | diff[type: VirtualDOM Ã— VirtualDOM â†’ Patch, notation: diff, desc: computes changes] | patch[type: Patch â†’ Effect, notation: patch, desc: applies changes to actual DOM]
type_definitions: State[def: Application data that drives rendering, format: latex] | VirtualDOM[def: Tree representation of UI, format: latex] | Patch[def: SetâŸ¨OperationâŸ© where Operation := Insert | Update | Delete | Move, format: latex] | RealDOM[def: Actual browser DOM, format: latex]
properties: P.F4.1.1:Reactivity[spec: state changes â†’ render(state) â†’ diff â†’ patch â†’ updated DOM Automatic propagation, format: latex] | P.F4.1.2:Minimal Updates[spec: âˆ€sâ‚, sâ‚‚ âˆˆ State: patch(diff(render(sâ‚), render(sâ‚‚))) applies minimal changes, format: latex] | P.F4.1.3:Consistency[spec: âˆ€s âˆˆ State: visual_output(s) = render(s) What you see reflects state, format: latex]
operations: Update[sig: update(new_state: State) â†’ Effect, def: $update(new_state: State) â†’ Effect = old_vdom := render(current_state) new_vdom := render(new_state) patch := diff(old_vdom, new_vdom) apply_patch(patch, real_dom) current_state := new_state$, format: latex] | Diff[sig: diff(old: VirtualDOM, new: VirtualDOM) â†’ Patch, def: $diff(old: VirtualDOM, new: VirtualDOM) â†’ Patch = if old = new: return [] if different_type(old, new): return [Replace(old, new)] if different_props(old, new): ops := [UpdateProps(old, new)] else: ops := [] ops := ops + diff_children(old.children, new.children) return ops$, format: latex] | Apply Patch[sig: apply_patch(patch: Patch, dom: RealDOM) â†’ Effect, def: $apply_patch(patch: Patch, dom: RealDOM) â†’ Effect = for op in patch: case op of Insert(node, parent, index) â†’ parent.insert_child(node, index) Update(node, props) â†’ node.update_properties(props) Delete(node) â†’ node.remove() Move(node, new_parent, new_index) â†’ move(node, new_parent, new_index)$, format: latex]
manifestations: React/Vue/Svelte rendering | Virtual DOM frameworks | Incremental rendering | Reactive UI libraries | Real-time dashboards

components: trigger[type: Event â†’ Notification, notation: trigger, desc: creates notification from event] | route[type: Notification â†’ SetâŸ¨ChannelâŸ©, notation: route, desc: selects delivery channels] | format[type: (Notification, Channel) â†’ Message, notation: format, desc: formats for channel] | deliver[type: (Message, Channel) â†’ Effect, notation: deliver, desc: sends notification]
type_definitions: Notification[def: (id: String, type: NotificationType,, format: latex] | Channel[def: Email | Push | SMS | InApp | Webhook, format: latex] | Priority[def: Urgent | High | Normal | Low, format: latex] | NotificationType[def: Alert | Info | Success | Warning | Error, format: latex]
properties: P.F4.2.1:Priority-Based Delivery[spec: âˆ€n âˆˆ Notifications: priority(n) = Urgent â‡’ all_channels_enabled(n) âˆ§ immediate_delivery(n), format: latex] | P.F4.2.2:User Preferences[spec: âˆ€u âˆˆ Users, n âˆˆ Notifications: deliver(n, channel) only if user_allows(u, channel, type(n)), format: latex] | P.F4.2.3:Deduplication[spec: âˆ€nâ‚, nâ‚‚: similar(nâ‚, nâ‚‚) âˆ§ recent(nâ‚) â‡’ suppress(nâ‚‚), format: latex]
operations: Notify[sig: notify(event: Event) â†’ Effect, def: $notify(event: Event) â†’ Effect = notification := trigger(event) if should_suppress(notification): return channels := route(notification) for channel in channels: message := format(notification, channel) deliver(message, channel) log_delivery(notification, channel)$, format: latex] | Route[sig: route(notification: Notification) â†’ SetâŸ¨ChannelâŸ©, def: $route(notification: Notification) â†’ SetâŸ¨ChannelâŸ© = user := notification.recipient preferences := user.notification_preferences channels := {} case notification.priority of Urgent â†’ channels := all_channels(user) High â†’ channels := preferred_channels(user) âˆª {InApp} Normal â†’ channels := preferred_channels(user) Low â†’ channels := {InApp} return channels âˆ© enabled_channels(preferences, notification.type)$, format: latex] | Format[sig: format(notification: Notification, channel: Channel) â†’ Message, def: $format(notification: Notification, channel: Channel) â†’ Message = case channel of Email â†’ format_email(notification.subject, notification.body, notification.action_url) Push â†’ format_push(notification.title, notification.short_text, notification.icon) SMS â†’ format_sms(notification.short_text, max_length=160) InApp â†’ format_in_app(notification.full_content) Webhook â†’ format_json(notification)$, format: latex]
manifestations: Alert systems | Email notifications | Push notifications | In-app messages | Webhook deliveries

components: source[type: InternalData, notation: source, desc: internal data to export] | transform[type: InternalData â†’ ExternalFormat, notation: transform, desc: converts to external format] | validate[type: ExternalFormat â†’ Valid | Invalid, notation: validate, desc: checks output validity] | publish[type: Valid â†’ Destination, notation: publish, desc: delivers to target]
type_definitions: InternalData[def: Data in system's internal representation, format: latex] | ExternalFormat[def: JSON | XML | CSV | PDF | HTML | Binary, format: latex] | Destination[def: File | URL | API | Stream | Storage, format: latex] | PublishResult[def: Success(url: URL) | Failure(error: Error), format: latex]
properties: P.F4.3.1:Format Compliance[spec: âˆ€d âˆˆ InternalData: validate(transform(d)) = Valid â‡’ conforms_to_spec(transform(d)), format: latex] | P.F4.3.2:Lossless Export[spec: âˆ€d âˆˆ InternalData: can_round_trip(d) â‡’ import(transform(d)) = d, format: latex] | P.F4.3.3:Atomic Publish[spec: âˆ€d âˆˆ Data: publish(d) succeeds completely âˆ¨ rolls back completely, format: latex]
operations: Export[sig: export(data: InternalData, format: FormatType, dest: Destination) â†’ PublishResult, def: $export(data: InternalData, format: FormatType, dest: Destination) â†’ PublishResult = try: external := transform(data, format) if validate(external) â‰  Valid: return Failure("Validation failed") result := publish(external, dest) return result catch error: return Failure(error)$, format: latex] | Transform[sig: transform(data: InternalData, format: FormatType) â†’ ExternalFormat, def: $transform(data: InternalData, format: FormatType) â†’ ExternalFormat = case format of JSON â†’ serialize_json(data) XML â†’ serialize_xml(data, schema) CSV â†’ flatten_to_csv(data) PDF â†’ render_pdf(data, template) HTML â†’ render_html(data, template)$, format: latex] | Publish[sig: publish(data: ExternalFormat, dest: Destination) â†’ PublishResult, def: $publish(data: ExternalFormat, dest: Destination) â†’ PublishResult = case dest of File(path) â†’ write_file(path, data) return Success(file_url(path)) URL(endpoint) â†’ response := http_post(endpoint, data) return Success(response.location) API(service) â†’ id := service.create(data) return Success(service.url(id)) Storage(bucket) â†’ key := bucket.put(data) return Success(bucket.url(key))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Document export[PDF, Word] | API publishing | Data export[CSV, JSON] | Report generation | Static site generation

components: query[type: Query, notation: query, desc: defines the view computation] | compute[type: Data â†’ Result, notation: compute, desc: executes the query] | cache[type: Result, notation: cache, desc: stores computed result] | refresh[type: Trigger â†’ Effect, notation: refresh, desc: updates materialized view]
type_definitions: Query[def: (select: Projection, from: Source, where: Predicate, aggregate: Function), format: latex] | Result[def: Computed and cached query result, format: latex] | Trigger[def: OnDemand | OnChange | Scheduled(interval: Time), format: latex] | Staleness[def: Time since last refresh, format: latex]
properties: P.F4.4.1:Consistency Eventually[spec: âˆ€m âˆˆ MaterializedViews: after_refresh(m) â‡’ cache(m) = compute(query(m), current_data), format: latex] | P.F4.4.2:Performance Trade-off[spec: read_cost(materialized_view) << read_cost(base_query) âˆ§ maintenance_cost(materialized_view) > 0, format: latex] | P.F4.4.3:Staleness Bound[spec: âˆ€m âˆˆ MaterializedViews: staleness(m) â‰¤ max_staleness(m) âˆ¨ trigger_refresh(m), format: latex]
operations: Read[sig: read(view: MaterializedView) â†’ Result, def: $read(view: MaterializedView) â†’ Result = if stale(view): if refresh_strategy = OnDemand: refresh(view) return cache[view]$, format: latex] | Refresh[sig: refresh(view: MaterializedView) â†’ Effect, def: $refresh(view: MaterializedView) â†’ Effect = start_transaction() new_result := compute(view.query, current_data) cache[view] := new_result last_refreshed[view] := now() commit_transaction() notify_subscribers(view)$, format: latex] | Incremental Refresh[sig: incremental_refresh(view: MaterializedView, changes: SetâŸ¨ChangeâŸ©) â†’ Effect, def: $incremental_refresh(view: MaterializedView, changes: SetâŸ¨ChangeâŸ©) â†’ Effect = affected := filter_relevant_changes(changes, view.query) if empty(affected): return // No update needed if can_update_incrementally(view, affected): cache[view] := apply_incremental_update(cache[view], affected) else: refresh(view) // Full refresh$, format: latex]
manifestations: Database materialized views | Cached aggregations | Precomputed reports | Search indices | Dashboard metrics

type_definitions: ErrorType[def: Transient | Permanent | Recoverable, format: latex] | RecoveryStrategy[def: Retry(max: â„•, backoff: Time â†’ Time) |, format: latex] | Operation[def: () â†’ Result | Error, format: latex]
properties: P.F6.1:Error Classification[spec: âˆ€e âˆˆ Error: classify(e) determines appropriate recovery strategy Transient â†’ Retry Permanent â†’ Report Recoverable â†’ Fallback | GracefulDegradation, format: latex] | P.F6.2:Recovery Exhaustion[spec: âˆ€recovery_attempt: attempts â‰¤ max_attempts âˆ¨ escalate(error), format: latex] | P.F6.3:State Safety[spec: âˆ€e âˆˆ Error: recover(e) preserves system invariants No partial state corruption, format: latex]
operations: Retry with Backoff[sig: retry(operation: Operation, max_attempts: â„•) â†’ Result | Error, def: $retry(operation: Operation, max_attempts: â„•) â†’ Result | Error = attempts := 0 while attempts < max_attempts: try: return operation() catch error: if transient(error): wait(2^attempts Â· base_delay) attempts := attempts + 1 else: throw error throw MaxAttemptsExceeded$, format: latex] | Circuit Breaker[sig: circuit_breaker(operation: Operation, threshold: â„•) â†’ Result | Error, def: $circuit_breaker(operation: Operation, threshold: â„•) â†’ Result | Error = state := Closed failures := 0 execute(): case state of Closed â†’ try: result := operation() failures := 0 return result catch error: failures := failures + 1 if failures â‰¥ threshold: state := Open schedule_half_open(timeout) throw error Open â†’ throw CircuitOpenError HalfOpen â†’ try: result := operation() state := Closed return result catch error: state := Open throw error$, format: latex] | Graceful Degradation[sig: degrade(levels: SequenceâŸ¨ModeâŸ©, operation: Mode â†’ Result) â†’ Result, def: $degrade(levels: SequenceâŸ¨ModeâŸ©, operation: Mode â†’ Result) â†’ Result = for mode in levels: try: return operation(mode) catch error: continue throw AllModesFailedError$, format: latex]
manifestations: Network request retry[HTTP clients with backoff] | File load fallback[multiple locations/mirrors] | Service degradation[cache â†’ static â†’ error] | Database connection pooling[retry on transient failures] | User retry prompts[try again button]

components: Sources[type: SetâŸ¨SourceâŸ©, notation: Sources, desc: set of source documents with metadata] | Inline_{refs}[type: MapâŸ¨TextSpan, SourceIdâŸ©, notation: Inline_{refs}, desc: mapping from content spans to sources] | Links[type: SetâŸ¨URIâŸ©, notation: Links, desc: hyperlinks to original sources] | Verification[type: SourceId â†’ Boolean, notation: Verification, desc: verifies source accessibility and validity]
type_definitions: Source[def: $\text{Source} = (\text{id}, \text{title}, \text{author}, \text{date}, \text{URI}, \text{confidence})$, format: latex] | TextSpan[def: $\text{TextSpan} = (\text{start}, \text{end}) \subset \mathbb{N} \times \mathbb{N}$ (character range), format: latex] | Confidence[def: $\text{Confidence} = [0, 1] \subset \mathbb{R}$ (source reliability score), format: latex]
properties: P.P100.1:Complete Citation[spec: $\forall span \in \text{Content} : \exists s \in Sources : Inline_{refs}(span) = s.id$ (every claim cited), format: latex] | P.P100.2:Verified Sources[spec: $\forall s \in Sources : Verification(s.id) = \text{true}$ (all sources accessible), format: latex] | P.P100.3:Confidence Transparency[spec: $\forall s \in Sources : s.confidence \in [0,1]$ is visible to user, format: latex] | P.P100.4:Bidirectional Linking[spec: $span \xrightarrow{\text{cites}} source \land source \xrightarrow{\text{cited-by}} span$ (navigable both ways), format: latex]
operations: Add Citation[sig: addCitation: TextSpan Ã— Source â†’ C_source, def: $\text{addCitation}(span, src) = C'_{source}$where$Sources' = Sources \cup \{src\}$$Inline_{refs}' = Inline_{refs} \oplus [span \mapsto src.id]$$Links' = Links \cup \{src.URI\}$, format: latex] | Verify All Sources[sig: verifyAll: C_source â†’ SetâŸ¨SourceId Ã— BooleanâŸ©, def: $\text{verifyAll}(C_{source}) = \{(s.id, accessible(s.URI)) \mid s \in Sources\}$where$accessible: URI \to Boolean$checks validity, format: latex] | Get Citations for Span[sig: getCitations: TextSpan â†’ SetâŸ¨SourceâŸ©, def: $\text{getCitations}(span) = \{s \in Sources \mid Inline_{refs}(span) = s.id\}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Academic citations[numbered references [1], [2] in papers] | Wikipedia footnotes[superscript citation markers with source links] | AI-generated content citations[LLM outputs with inline source attribution] | GraphRAG citations[knowledge graph path visualization with sources]

components: Query[type: String Ã— Embedding, notation: Query, desc: user query with vector embedding] | Path_{retrieval}[type: SeqâŸ¨Node Ã— EdgeâŸ©, notation: Path_{retrieval}, desc: sequence of nodes and edges traversed in graph] | Nodes_{visited}[type: SetâŸ¨NodeâŸ©, notation: Nodes_{visited}, desc: all nodes explored during retrieval] | Score_{relevance}[type: Node â†’ [0,1], notation: Score_{relevance}, desc: relevance score for each node]
type_definitions: Node[def: $\text{Node} = (\text{id}, \text{content}, \text{embedding}, \text{type})$ (knowledge graph vertex), format: latex] | Edge[def: $\text{Edge} = (\text{source}, \text{target}, \text{relation}, \text{weight})$ (knowledge graph edge), format: latex] | Embedding[def: $\text{Embedding} = \mathbb{R}^d$ (dense vector representation), format: latex]
properties: P.P101.1:Path Explainability[spec: $\forall (n_i, e_i) \in Path_{retrieval} : \text{explain}(e_i) \to \text{why } n_{i} \to n_{i+1}$ (each hop justified), format: latex] | P.P101.2:Monotonic Relevance[spec: $\forall n_i, n_{i+1} \in Path_{retrieval} : Score_{relevance}(n_{i+1}) \leq Score_{relevance}(n_i)$ (decreasing along path), format: latex] | P.P101.3:Connected Path[spec: $\forall i : \exists e \in \text{Edges} : e.source = n_i \land e.target = n_{i+1}$ (valid graph path), format: latex] | P.P101.4:Multi-Hop Reasoning[spec: $|Path_{retrieval}| \geq 1$ enables reasoning beyond direct neighbors, format: latex]
operations: Trace Retrieval[sig: traceRetrieval: Query Ã— Graph â†’ Path_retrieval, def: $\text{traceRetrieval}(q, G) = \text{path}$where$n_0 = \arg\max_{n \in G} \text{sim}(q.embedding, n.embedding)$$path = [n_0] \oplus \text{expand}(n_0, q, k)$(k-hop expansion), format: latex] | Visualize Path[sig: visualizePath: Path_retrieval â†’ Rendering, def: $\text{visualizePath}(path) = \text{render}$where$\text{render}.nodes = \{n \mid (n, e) \in path\}$$\text{render}.edges = \{e \mid (n, e) \in path\}$$\text{render}.highlights = \text{relevance-based colors}$, format: latex] | Score Path[sig: scorePath: Path_retrieval â†’ â„, def: $\text{scorePath}(path) = \sum_{i=1}^{|path|} \frac{Score_{relevance}(n_i)}{i^\alpha}$(decaying sum,$\alpha > 0$), format: latex]
manifestations: GraphRAG retrieval visualization[Microsoft GraphRAG path display] | Neo4j Bloom path exploration[interactive graph path highlighting] | Knowledge graph explainability[shows reasoning chain from query to answer] | RAG citation paths[visualizes document retrieval reasoning]

components: Text[type: SeqâŸ¨TextSpanâŸ©, notation: Text, desc: sequence of text segments] | Conf_{scores}[type: TextSpan â†’ [0,1], notation: Conf_{scores}, desc: confidence mapping for each span] | Colors[type: [0,1] â†’ RGB, notation: Colors, desc: color scale from low to high confidence] | Thresholds[type: SeqâŸ¨â„âŸ©, notation: Thresholds, desc: confidence thresholds for coloring tiers]
type_definitions: TextSpan[def: $\text{TextSpan} = (\text{start}, \text{end}, \text{content})$ where $\text{start}, \text{end} \in \mathbb{N}$, format: latex] | RGB[def: $\text{RGB} = [0, 255]^3 \subset \mathbb{N}^3$ (red, green, blue color components), format: latex] | ConfidenceLevel[def: $\text{Level} = \{\text{high}, \text{medium}, \text{low}, \text{uncertain}\}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P102.1:Monotonic Color Mapping[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in [0,1] : c_1 > c_2 \implies \text{brightness}(Colors(c_1)) > \text{brightness}(Colors(c_2))$, format: latex] | P.P102.2:Complete Coverage[spec: $\forall span \in Text : \exists c \in [0,1] : Conf_{scores}(span) = c$ (every span has confidence), format: latex] | P.P102.3:Threshold Ordering[spec: $\forall i, j : i < j \implies Thresholds[i] < Thresholds[j]$ (increasing sequence), format: latex] | P.P102.4:Visual Distinguishability[spec: $\forall t_i, t_{i+1} \in Thresholds : \Delta E(Colors(t_i), Colors(t_{i+1})) > \tau$ (perceptually distinct), format: latex]
operations: Apply Highlighting[sig: applyHighlighting: Text Ã— Conf_scores â†’ StyledText, def: $\text{applyHighlighting}(text, conf) = \text{styled}$where$\forall span \in text : \text{styled}[span].color = Colors(conf(span))$, format: latex] | Categorize Confidence[sig: categorize: â„ â†’ ConfidenceLevel, def: $\text{categorize}(c) = \begin{cases} \text{high} & \text{if } c \geq t_3 \\ \text{medium} & \text{if } t_2 \leq c < t_3 \\ \text{low} & \text{if } t_1 \leq c < t_2 \\ \text{uncertain} & \text{if } c < t_1 \end{cases}$where$t_1, t_2, t_3 \in Thresholds$, format: latex] | Interpolate Color[sig: interpolate: [0,1] â†’ RGB, def: $\text{interpolate}(c) = (1-c) \cdot \text{color}_{low} + c \cdot \text{color}_{high}$(linear gradient), format: latex]
manifestations: AI fact-checking highlights[color-coded confidence in generated claims] | Spell-checker confidence[red/yellow/green underlines for spelling suggestions] | LLM output confidence visualization[token-level confidence heatmaps] | Citation confidence display[highlight strength based on source reliability]

components: Sources[type: SetâŸ¨Source Ã— ClaimâŸ©, notation: Sources, desc: multiple sources making potentially conflicting claims] | Conflicts[type: SetâŸ¨Claim Ã— Claim Ã— ConflictTypeâŸ©, notation: Conflicts, desc: detected contradictions between sources] | Resolution[type: Conflict â†’ ResolvedClaim, notation: Resolution, desc: strategy for resolving conflicts] | Display[type: ResolvedClaim â†’ Visualization, notation: Display, desc: how to present reconciled information]
type_definitions: Claim[def: $\text{Claim} = (\text{statement}, \text{timestamp}, \text{confidence})$ (factual assertion), format: latex] | ConflictType[def: $\text{ConflictType} = \{\text{contradiction}, \text{uncertainty}, \text{temporal}, \text{partial}\}$, format: latex] | ResolvedClaim[def: $\text{ResolvedClaim} = (\text{merged\_claim}, \text{consensus\_score}, \text{dissenting\_sources})$, format: latex]
properties: P.P103.1:Conflict Detection Completeness[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in \text{Claims} : \text{contradicts}(c_1, c_2) \implies (c_1, c_2, t) \in Conflicts$ for some $t$, format: latex] | P.P103.2:Source Authority Weighting[spec: $\text{consensus\_score}(claim) = \sum_{s \in \text{supporting}(claim)} w(s.authority)$ where $\sum w = 1$, format: latex] | P.P103.3:Transparency of Dissent[spec: $\forall r \in \text{ResolvedClaim} : |r.dissenting\_sources| > 0 \implies \text{visible}(r.dissenting\_sources)$, format: latex] | P.P103.4:Temporal Consistency[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 : c_1.timestamp < c_2.timestamp \implies \text{priority}(c_2) > \text{priority}(c_1)$ (recency bias), format: latex]
operations: Detect Conflicts[sig: detectConflicts: SetâŸ¨Source Ã— ClaimâŸ© â†’ SetâŸ¨ConflictâŸ©, def: $\text{detectConflicts}(S) = \{(c_1, c_2, t) \mid$$(s_1, c_1), (s_2, c_2) \in S \land s_1 \neq s_2 \land$$t = \text{classifyConflict}(c_1, c_2)\}$, format: latex] | Resolve Conflict[sig: resolve: Conflict â†’ ResolvedClaim, def: $\text{resolve}(c_1, c_2, t) = r$where$r.merged\_claim = \text{merge}(c_1, c_2, t)$$r.consensus\_score = \frac{|\text{supporting}(r)|}{|\text{all\_sources}|}$$r.dissenting = \{s \mid s \text{ contradicts } r\}$, format: latex] | Visualize Disagreement[sig: visualizeDisagreement: ResolvedClaim â†’ Visualization, def: $\text{visualizeDisagreement}(r) = \text{view}$where$\text{view}.main = r.merged\_claim$$\text{view}.alternatives = \{c \mid c \in r.dissenting\}$$\text{view}.consensus\_bar = r.consensus\_score \times 100\%$, format: latex]
manifestations: Wikipedia edit conflicts[merging multiple editor contributions] | AI-aggregated answers[combining multiple LLM responses] | News aggregation with bias detection[showing consensus and dissenting views] | Multi-RAG source reconciliation[resolving conflicting retrieved documents]

components: G[type: GraphâŸ¨V, EâŸ©, notation: G, desc: underlying knowledge graph] | Q_{visual}[type: VisualQuery, notation: Q_{visual}, desc: visual pattern representation] | Cypher[type: String, notation: Cypher, desc: generated query language text] | Execute[type: Cypher â†’ ResultSet, notation: Execute, desc: query execution function]
type_definitions: Graph[def: $\text{Graph} = (V, E, \lambda_V, \lambda_E)$ where $V$ are vertices, $E \subseteq V \times V$ edges, $\lambda$ label functions, format: latex] | VisualQuery[def: $\text{VisualQuery} = (\text{nodes}, \text{edges}, \text{constraints})$ (pattern graph), format: latex] | ResultSet[def: $\text{ResultSet} = \text{Set}\langle \text{Binding} \rangle$ where $\text{Binding} = \text{Var} \to \text{Node}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P104.1:Visual-Textual Isomorphism[spec: $\forall q : \text{semantics}(Q_{visual}) \equiv \text{semantics}(Cypher)$ (equivalent meaning), format: latex] | P.P104.2:Incremental Query Building[spec: $Q_{visual}^{(t+1)} = Q_{visual}^{(t)} \oplus \text{addPattern}(\pi)$ (compositional), format: latex] | P.P104.3:Type Safety[spec: $\forall e \in Q_{visual}.edges : \text{type}(e.source) \text{ compatible with } \text{type}(e.target)$, format: latex] | P.P104.4:Query Optimization[spec: $Execute(Cypher) = Execute(\text{optimize}(Cypher))$ (semantic preserving optimization), format: latex]
operations: Add Node Pattern[sig: addNode: VisualQuery Ã— NodeConstraint â†’ VisualQuery, def: $\text{addNode}(q, n) = q'$where$q'.nodes = q.nodes \cup \{n\}$$q'.constraints = q.constraints \cup \text{constraintsOf}(n)$, format: latex] | Compile to Cypher[sig: compile: VisualQuery â†’ Cypher, def: $\text{compile}(q) = \text{cypher}$where$\text{cypher} = \text{MATCH } \text{pattern}(q.nodes, q.edges)$$\text{ WHERE } \text{constraints}(q.constraints)$$\text{ RETURN } \text{variables}(q.nodes)$, format: latex] | Execute Query[sig: execute: Cypher Ã— Graph â†’ ResultSet, def: $\text{execute}(cypher, G) = \{b \mid b : \text{Var} \to V \land \text{satisfies}(b, cypher, G)\}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Neo4j Bloom query builder[visual graph pattern matching] | GraphQL visual editor[drag-and-drop query construction] | SPARQL query builder[visual RDF triple pattern editor] | Knowledge graph exploration interface[interactive pattern-based search]

components: Concepts[type: SetâŸ¨ConceptâŸ©, notation: Concepts, desc: set of semantic concepts to compare] | Sim_{matrix}[type: Concept Ã— Concept â†’ [0,1], notation: Sim_{matrix}, desc: pairwise similarity scores] | Layout[type: Concept â†’ â„Â², notation: Layout, desc: 2D spatial positioning of concepts] | Threshold[type: â„ âˆˆ [0,1], notation: Threshold, desc: minimum similarity to display connection]
type_definitions: Concept[def: $\text{Concept} = (\text{id}, \text{label}, \text{embedding})$ where $\text{embedding} \in \mathbb{R}^d$, format: latex] | SimilarityMetric[def: $\text{SimilarityMetric} = \{\text{cosine}, \text{euclidean}, \text{jaccard}, \text{semantic}\}$, format: latex] | LayoutAlgorithm[def: $\text{LayoutAlgorithm} = \{\text{force-directed}, \text{tsne}, \text{umap}, \text{mds}\}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P105.1:Similarity Symmetry[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in Concepts : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) = Sim_{matrix}(c_2, c_1)$ (symmetric), format: latex] | P.P105.2:Distance Preservation[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) > Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_3) \implies$ $\|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_2)\| < \|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_3)\|$ (spatial proximity reflects similarity), format: latex] | P.P105.3:Threshold Filtering[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) < Threshold \implies \neg \text{visible}(\text{edge}(c_1, c_2))$, format: latex] | P.P105.4:Self-Similarity Identity[spec: $\forall c \in Concepts : Sim_{matrix}(c, c) = 1$ (maximum self-similarity), format: latex]
operations: Compute Similarity Matrix[sig: computeSimilarity: SetâŸ¨ConceptâŸ© Ã— SimilarityMetric â†’ Matrix, def: $\text{computeSimilarity}(C, metric) = M$where$M[i,j] = \text{metric}(c_i.embedding, c_j.embedding)$$\text{for cosine: } M[i,j] = \frac{e_i \cdot e_j}{\|e_i\| \|e_j\|}$, format: latex] | Generate Layout[sig: generateLayout: Sim_matrix Ã— LayoutAlgorithm â†’ (Concept â†’ â„Â²), def: $\text{generateLayout}(M, alg) = L$where$L = \arg\min_{L'} \sum_{i,j} (M[i,j] - \frac{1}{\|L'(c_i) - L'(c_j)\|}^2$(stress minimization), format: latex] | Filter by Threshold[sig: filter: Sim_matrix Ã— â„ â†’ SetâŸ¨EdgeâŸ©, def: $\text{filter}(M, \theta) = \{(c_i, c_j) \mid M[i,j] \geq \theta \land i \neq j\}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Embedding space visualization[t-SNE/UMAP plots of concept embeddings] | Document similarity networks[graph showing related documents] | Topic clustering visualization[semantic clusters in 2D space] | Knowledge graph similarity view[concepts positioned by semantic distance]

tuple_notation: $U_{auto} = (Content, Sources, Monitor, Update_{trigger}) : Document \times Time \to Document'$
components: Content[type: Document, notation: Content, desc: The document or content being monitored and updated] | Sources[type: SetâŸ¨SourceâŸ©, notation: Sources, desc: External data sources that content depends on] | Monitor[type: Source â†’ Change?, notation: Monitor, desc: Function that detects changes in monitored sources] | Update_{trigger}[type: Change â†’ Effect, notation: Update_{trigger}, desc: Triggers content update when source changes are detected]
properties: P.P106.1:Freshness Guarantee[spec: âˆ€s âˆˆ Sources: changed(s) â‡’ eventually(updated(Content)), format: latex, desc: Content must eventually reflect changes in monitored sources] | P.P106.2:Update Latency[spec: âˆ€change: time(Update_{trigger}(change)) - time(Monitor(source)) < Î”t_{max}, format: latex, desc: Updates must occur within maximum latency threshold] | P.P106.3:Consistency During Update[spec: âˆ€update: Content remains readable âˆ§ consistent during update process, format: latex, desc: Content must remain in valid state throughout update process]
operations: Subscribe[sig: subscribe(s: Source) â†’ Effect, def: subscribe(s) = Sources := Sources âˆª {s}; start_monitoring(s), format: latex] | CheckUpdates[sig: check() â†’ SetâŸ¨ChangeâŸ©, def: check() = {Monitor(s) | s âˆˆ Sources âˆ§ Monitor(s) â‰  null}, format: latex] | ApplyUpdate[sig: update(changes: SetâŸ¨ChangeâŸ©) â†’ Document, def: update(changes) = fold(changes, Content, Î»(doc, change): apply_change(doc, change)), format: latex]
manifestations: Example 1[Real-world manifestation example 1] | Example 2[Real-world manifestation example 2] | Example 3[Real-world manifestation example 3]

components: Content[type: Document, notation: Content, desc: original document content to be improved] | Improvements[type: SetâŸ¨EditâŸ©, notation: Improvements, desc: set of AI-suggested edits with rationale] | Confidence[type: Edit â†’ [0,1], notation: Confidence, desc: confidence score for each suggested edit] | Approval[type: Edit â†’ \{\text{pending}, \text{accepted}, \text{rejected}\}, notation: Approval, desc: approval state for each edit]
type_definitions: Edit[def: $\text{Edit} = (\text{span}, \text{original}, \text{replacement}, \text{reason}, \text{category})$, format: latex] | EditCategory[def: $\text{Category} = \{\text{grammar}, \text{clarity}, \text{factual}, \text{style}, \text{structure}\}$, format: latex] | Span[def: $\text{Span} = (\text{start}, \text{end}) \subset \mathbb{N} \times \mathbb{N}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P107.1:Non-Overlapping Edits[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in Improvements : e_1 \neq e_2 \implies e_1.span \cap e_2.span = \emptyset$ (disjoint), format: latex] | P.P107.2:Confidence-Based Ranking[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 : Confidence(e_1) > Confidence(e_2) \implies \text{priority}(e_1) > \text{priority}(e_2)$, format: latex] | P.P107.3:Explainable Suggestions[spec: $\forall e \in Improvements : \exists r \in \text{String} : e.reason = r \land |r| > 0$ (all edits explained), format: latex] | P.P107.4:Content Preservation[spec: $\forall e \in Improvements : \text{semantics}(e.original) \approx \text{semantics}(e.replacement)$, format: latex]
operations: Generate Suggestions[sig: generateSuggestions: Document â†’ SetâŸ¨EditâŸ©, def: $\text{generateSuggestions}(doc) = \{e \mid$$e = \text{LLM}_{\text{editor}}(span, \text{context}(span)) \land$$Confidence(e) \geq \theta_{min}\}$, format: latex] | Apply Edit[sig: applyEdit: Document Ã— Edit â†’ Document, def: $\text{applyEdit}(doc, e) = doc'$where$doc'[e.span] = e.replacement$$Approval(e) \leftarrow \text{accepted}$, format: latex] | Batch Apply[sig: batchApply: Document Ã— SetâŸ¨EditâŸ© â†’ Document, def: $\text{batchApply}(doc, E) = \text{fold}(\text{applyEdit}, doc, \text{sorted}(E))$where$\text{sorted}$orders by span position, format: latex]
manifestations: Grammarly suggestions[inline grammar and style improvements] | GitHub Copilot code suggestions[AI-suggested code improvements] | Google Docs Smart Compose[contextual writing suggestions] | Notion AI suggested edits[content improvement recommendations]

components: Docs[type: SetâŸ¨DocumentâŸ©, notation: Docs, desc: collection of interrelated documents] | Relationships[type: SetâŸ¨LinkâŸ©, notation: Relationships, desc: semantic relationships between documents] | Auto_{link}[type: (Document Ã— Document) â†’ [0,1], notation: Auto_{link}, desc: AI-computed relevance score for linking] | Display[type: Link â†’ Visualization, notation: Display, desc: how links are rendered in UI]
type_definitions: Link[def: $\text{Link} = (\text{source}, \text{target}, \text{relation\_type}, \text{bidirectional})$, format: latex] | RelationType[def: $\text{RelationType} = \{\text{references}, \text{extends}, \text{contradicts}, \text{supports}, \text{related}\}$, format: latex] | Document[def: $\text{Document} = (\text{id}, \text{content}, \text{metadata}, \text{embedding})$, format: latex]
properties: P.P108.1:Automatic Discovery[spec: $\forall d_1, d_2 \in Docs : Auto_{link}(d_1, d_2) > \theta \implies \exists l \in Relationships : l.source = d_1 \land l.target = d_2$, format: latex] | P.P108.2:Bidirectional Navigation[spec: $\forall l \in Relationships : l.bidirectional = \text{true} \implies \exists l' : l'.source = l.target \land l'.target = l.source$, format: latex] | P.P108.3:Transitive Suggestions[spec: $(d_1, d_2) \in Relationships \land (d_2, d_3) \in Relationships \implies \text{suggest}(d_1, d_3)$ (transitive), format: latex] | P.P108.4:Semantic Consistency[spec: $\forall l : \text{similarity}(l.source.embedding, l.target.embedding) \geq \epsilon > 0$, format: latex]
operations: Discover Links[sig: discoverLinks: SetâŸ¨DocumentâŸ© â†’ SetâŸ¨LinkâŸ©, def: $\text{discoverLinks}(D) = \{(d_1, d_2, t, b) \mid$$d_1, d_2 \in D \land d_1 \neq d_2 \land$$Auto_{link}(d_1, d_2) > \theta \land$$t = \text{classifyRelation}(d_1, d_2)\}$, format: latex] | Add Manual Link[sig: addLink: Document Ã— Document Ã— RelationType â†’ Link, def: $\text{addLink}(d_1, d_2, t) = l$where$l = (d_1, d_2, t, \text{true})$$Relationships' = Relationships \cup \{l\}$, format: latex] | Get Related Documents[sig: getRelated: Document Ã— â„• â†’ SeqâŸ¨DocumentâŸ©, def: $\text{getRelated}(d, k) = \text{top-k}(\{d' \mid (d, d', t, b) \in Relationships\}, Auto_{link}(d, \cdot))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Roam Research backlinks[bidirectional linking between notes] | Notion relation databases[structured cross-document relationships] | Wikipedia "See also" sections[related article suggestions] | Obsidian graph view[visual network of linked documents]

components: Content[type: Document, notation: Content, desc: document content to be checked for staleness] | Sources[type: SetâŸ¨Source Ã— TimestampâŸ©, notation: Sources, desc: external sources with last-checked timestamps] | Freshness[type: ContentSpan â†’ â„, notation: Freshness, desc: freshness score per content segment (higher = fresher)] | Alerts[type: SetâŸ¨AlertâŸ©, notation: Alerts, desc: detected outdated content notifications]
type_definitions: Alert[def: $\text{Alert} = (\text{span}, \text{reason}, \text{severity}, \text{suggested\_update})$, format: latex] | Severity[def: $\text{Severity} = \{\text{info}, \text{warning}, \text{critical}\}$, format: latex] | FreshnessScore[def: $\text{FreshnessScore} = [0, 1] \subset \mathbb{R}$ (0 = stale, 1 = fresh), format: latex]
properties: P.P109.1:Time-Based Decay[spec: $\forall span : Freshness(span) = e^{-\lambda \cdot \Delta t}$ where $\Delta t = \text{now}() - \text{lastUpdated}(span)$, format: latex] | P.P109.2:Source-Synchronized Staleness[spec: $\forall s \in Sources : \text{sourceChanged}(s) \implies \exists a \in Alerts : a.\text{reason} = \text{source\_updated}$, format: latex] | P.P109.3:Severity Threshold[spec: $\forall a \in Alerts : Freshness(a.span) < \theta_{critical} \implies a.severity = \text{critical}$, format: latex] | P.P109.4:Continuous Monitoring[spec: $\forall t \in \text{Time} : \exists \text{check}(Content, Sources) \text{ at interval } \Delta t_{check}$ (periodic), format: latex]
operations: Check Freshness[sig: checkFreshness: Document Ã— SetâŸ¨SourceâŸ© â†’ SetâŸ¨AlertâŸ©, def: $\text{checkFreshness}(doc, S) = \{a \mid$$\exists span \in doc : Freshness(span) < \theta \land$$a = (\span, \text{explain}(span), \text{severity}(span), \text{update}(span))\}$, format: latex] | Update Freshness Score[sig: updateFreshness: ContentSpan Ã— Source â†’ â„, def: $\text{updateFreshness}(span, src) = f'$where$\Delta t = \text{now}() - src.timestamp$$f' = e^{-\lambda \cdot \Delta t}$(exponential decay), format: latex] | Suggest Updates[sig: suggestUpdates: Alert â†’ SetâŸ¨EditâŸ©, def: $\text{suggestUpdates}(a) = \text{LLM}_{\text{updater}}(a.span, \text{latestSources}(a.span))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Wikipedia outdated tags["This article needs to be updated" banners] | Living documents (Elicit, Bit.ai)[automatic detection and update of stale content] | News article freshness indicators[timestamps and update badges] | Technical documentation staleness detection[alerts when API docs don't match code]

components: input[type: Input, notation: input, desc: input to validator/checker] | process[type: Input â†’ Output, notation: process, desc: processing function] | output[type: Output, notation: output, desc: output from validator/checker] | display[type: Output â†’ Visual, notation: display, desc: display function]
type_definitions: Input[def: $\text{Input} = \text{Data}$, format: latex] | Output[def: $\text{Output} = \text{Result}$, format: latex] | State[def: $\text{State} = (\text{data}, \text{timestamp})$, format: latex]
properties: P.P11.1:Correctness[spec: $\forall i : \text{valid}(i) \implies \text{correct}(\text{output}(i))$, format: latex] | P.P11.2:Performance[spec: $\Delta t_{process} < \text{threshold}$, format: latex] | P.P11.3:Consistency[spec: $\forall i_1, i_2 : i_1 = i_2 \implies \text{output}(i_1) = \text{output}(i_2)$, format: latex] | P.P11.4:Usability[spec: $\forall u : \text{usable}(u)$, format: latex]
operations: Process[sig: process: Input â†’ Output, def: $\text{process}(i) = o$ where $o$ is computed result, format: latex] | Display[sig: display: Output â†’ Effect, def: $\text{display}(o)$ shows output to user, format: latex] | Update[sig: update: State â†’ Effect, def: $\text{update}(s)$ refreshes display, format: latex]
manifestations: Validator/Checker in modern applications[implements validator/checker pattern] | Web-based validator/checker[browser implementation of validator/checker] | Mobile validator/checker[mobile app implementation]

components: Agents[type: SetâŸ¨AgentâŸ©, notation: Agents, desc: multiple AI agents collaborating on document] | Document[type: SharedDocument, notation: Document, desc: shared document state with version control] | Contributions[type: SeqâŸ¨ContributionâŸ©, notation: Contributions, desc: ordered sequence of agent contributions] | Coordination[type: Agent Ã— Agent â†’ Protocol, notation: Coordination, desc: coordination mechanism between agents]
type_definitions: Agent[def: $\text{Agent} = (\text{id}, \text{role}, \text{capabilities}, \text{state})$, format: latex] | Contribution[def: $\text{Contribution} = (\text{agent\_id}, \text{edit}, \text{timestamp}, \text{rationale})$, format: latex] | Protocol[def: $\text{Protocol} = \{\text{sequential}, \text{parallel}, \text{consensus}, \text{leader-follower}\}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P110.1:Conflict-Free Contributions[spec: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in Contributions : c_1.edit.span \cap c_2.edit.span \neq \emptyset \implies$ $\exists r \in \text{Resolution} : r(c_1, c_2) = c_{merged}$ (CRDT-like), format: latex] | P.P110.2:Agent Specialization[spec: $\forall a \in Agents : \exists r \in \text{Role} : a.role = r \land \text{expert}(a, r)$, format: latex] | P.P110.3:Collaborative Convergence[spec: $\lim_{t \to \infty} \text{quality}(\text{Document}_t) = \text{optimal}$ (agents improve document over time), format: latex] | P.P110.4:Attribution Transparency[spec: $\forall span \in Document : \exists c \in Contributions : c.edit.span = span$ (traceable authorship), format: latex]
operations: Coordinate Agents[sig: coordinate: SetâŸ¨AgentâŸ© Ã— Task â†’ SeqâŸ¨ContributionâŸ©, def: $\text{coordinate}(A, task) = \text{contributions}$where$\text{protocol} = Coordination(a_1, a_2)$$\text{contributions} = \text{execute}(A, task, \text{protocol})$, format: latex] | Merge Contributions[sig: merge: SeqâŸ¨ContributionâŸ© â†’ Document, def: $\text{merge}(C) = \text{fold}(\text{apply}, Document_0, C)$where$\text{apply}(doc, c) = \text{applyEdit}(doc, c.edit)$, format: latex] | Resolve Conflict[sig: resolve: Contribution Ã— Contribution â†’ Contribution, def: $\text{resolve}(c_1, c_2) = c_{merged}$where$c_{merged}.edit = \text{consensus}([c_1.edit, c_2.edit])$$c_{merged}.rationale = c_1.rationale \oplus c_2.rationale$, format: latex]
manifestations: MetaGPT multi-agent document generation[specialized agents collaboratively create documents] | AgentVerse collaborative writing[agent team coordination for content creation] | Google Docs with AI collaborators[multiple AI agents suggesting and editing simultaneously] | CrewAI document workflows[role-based agent collaboration on documents]

components: Versions[type: SeqâŸ¨VersionâŸ©, notation: Versions, desc: chronologically ordered document versions] | Changes[type: Version Ã— Version â†’ Delta, notation: Changes, desc: computed diff between consecutive versions] | Contributors[type: Version â†’ SetâŸ¨ActorâŸ©, notation: Contributors, desc: humans and AI agents that modified each version] | Timestamps[type: Version â†’ Time, notation: Timestamps, desc: temporal mapping of versions]
type_definitions: Version[def: $\text{Version} = (\text{id}, \text{content}, \text{metadata}, \text{parent})$, format: latex] | Delta[def: $\text{Delta} = \text{Set}\langle \text{Edit} \rangle$ (set of atomic edits), format: latex] | Actor[def: $\text{Actor} = \text{Human} \mid \text{Agent}$ (union type), format: latex]
properties: P.P111.1:Chronological Ordering[spec: $\forall v_i, v_{i+1} \in Versions : Timestamps(v_i) < Timestamps(v_{i+1})$ (monotonic time), format: latex] | P.P111.2:Version Continuity[spec: $\forall v_{i+1} \in Versions : \exists v_i : v_{i+1}.parent = v_i.id$ (except root version), format: latex] | P.P111.3:Complete Attribution[spec: $\forall v \in Versions : Contributors(v) \neq \emptyset$ (every change has author), format: latex] | P.P111.4:Reconstructability[spec: $\forall v_i \in Versions : v_i = \text{apply}(v_0, \bigoplus_{j=1}^{i} Changes(v_{j-1}, v_j))$ (replay history), format: latex]
operations: Compute Delta[sig: computeDelta: Version Ã— Version â†’ Delta, def: $\text{computeDelta}(v_1, v_2) = \{e \mid e = \text{diff}(v_1.content, v_2.content)\}$using Myers' diff algorithm or similar, format: latex] | Visualize Timeline[sig: visualize: SeqâŸ¨VersionâŸ© â†’ Rendering, def: $\text{visualize}(V) = \text{render}$where$\text{render}.timeline = \{(Timestamps(v), v.id, |Changes(v_{i-1}, v)|) \mid v \in V\}$$\text{render}.contributors = \text{aggregate}(Contributors, V)$, format: latex] | Time Travel[sig: timeTravel: Version Ã— Time â†’ Version, def: $\text{timeTravel}(v_{current}, t) = v_t$where$v_t = \arg\max_{v \in Versions} \{v \mid Timestamps(v) \leq t\}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Git history visualization[commit timeline with contributors and diffs] | Google Docs version history[temporal document evolution with named versions] | Wikipedia revision history[chronological edits with diff viewing] | Notion page history[version timeline with restore capability]

components: Events[type: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Events, desc: real-time stream of events] | Timeline[type: Time â†’ SetâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Timeline, desc: temporal index of events] | Filter[type: Event â†’ Boolean, notation: Filter, desc: predicate to filter events] | Aggregation[type: SeqâŸ¨EventâŸ© â†’ Aggregate, notation: Aggregation, desc: grouping and summarization of events]
type_definitions: Event[def: $\text{Event} = (\text{id}, \text{type}, \text{payload}, \text{timestamp}, \text{source})$, format: latex] | Stream[def: $\text{Stream}\langle T \rangle = \text{Time} \to \text{Option}\langle T \rangle$ (potentially infinite), format: latex] | Aggregate[def: $\text{Aggregate} = (\text{count}, \text{rate}, \text{distribution}, \text{statistics})$, format: latex]
properties: P.P112.1:Real-Time Responsiveness[spec: $\forall e \in Events : \Delta t_{display}(e) = t_{render}(e) - e.timestamp < 100ms$ (low latency), format: latex] | P.P112.2:Event Ordering[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in Events : e_1.timestamp < e_2.timestamp \implies \text{position}(e_1) < \text{position}(e_2)$, format: latex] | P.P112.3:Windowed Aggregation[spec: $\forall w \in \text{Windows} : Aggregation(w) = f(\{e \in Events \mid e.timestamp \in w\})$, format: latex] | P.P112.4:Filter Preservation[spec: $\forall e \in Events : Filter(e) = \text{true} \implies e \in \text{VisibleEvents}$, format: latex]
operations: Subscribe to Stream[sig: subscribe: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Filter â†’ StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, def: $\text{subscribe}(S, f) = S'$where$S'(t) = \begin{cases} S(t) & \text{if } f(S(t)) \\ \text{None} & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$, format: latex] | Aggregate Window[sig: aggregateWindow: SeqâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Window â†’ Aggregate, def: $\text{aggregateWindow}(E, w) = a$where$a.count = |E|$$a.rate = \frac{|E|}{w.duration}$$a.distribution = \text{groupBy}(E, \lambda e. e.type)$, format: latex] | Render Stream[sig: renderStream: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© â†’ Visualization, def: $\text{renderStream}(S) = v$where$v.\text{timeline} = \{(e.timestamp, e.type) \mid e \in S\}$$v.\text{aggregate} = Aggregation(\text{last\_n}(S, n))$, format: latex]
manifestations: Kafka real-time dashboard[streaming event visualization] | AG-UI protocol event display[16 event types rendered in real-time] | Datadog APM traces[distributed tracing event streams] | Grafana time-series graphs[aggregated event metrics visualization]

components: History[type: SeqâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: History, desc: recorded sequence of past events] | Selector[type: (Event â†’ Boolean) Ã— TimeRange, notation: Selector, desc: predicate and time range for replay selection] | Playback[type: PlaybackControl, notation: Playback, desc: controls for playback speed, pause, step] | State_{restore}[type: SeqâŸ¨EventâŸ© â†’ State, notation: State_{restore}, desc: reconstructs system state from event sequence]
type_definitions: PlaybackControl[def: $\text{PlaybackControl} = (\text{speed}, \text{position}, \text{mode})$ where $\text{speed} \in \mathbb{R}_{> 0}$, format: latex] | PlaybackMode[def: $\text{Mode} = \{\text{play}, \text{pause}, \text{step-forward}, \text{step-backward}, \text{reverse}\}$, format: latex] | TimeRange[def: $\text{TimeRange} = (t_{start}, t_{end})$ where $t_{start}, t_{end} \in \text{Time}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P113.1:Deterministic Replay[spec: $\forall H \in \text{History} : State_{restore}(H) = State_{original}$ (reproducible), format: latex] | P.P113.2:Speed Control[spec: $Playback.speed \in [0.1, 10] \implies \Delta t_{replay} = \frac{\Delta t_{original}}{Playback.speed}$, format: latex] | P.P113.3:Event Causality Preservation[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in History : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies \text{order}(e_1) < \text{order}(e_2)$ in replay, format: latex] | P.P113.4:Selective Replay[spec: $\text{replay}(Selector) = \{e \in History \mid Selector.predicate(e) \land e.timestamp \in Selector.range\}$, format: latex]
operations: Replay Events[sig: replay: SeqâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— PlaybackControl â†’ State, def: $\text{replay}(H, ctrl) = \text{foldl}(\text{apply}, State_0, H_{selected})$where$H_{selected}$respects$ctrl.mode$and$ctrl.speed$, format: latex] | Step Forward[sig: stepForward: State Ã— Event â†’ State, def: $\text{stepForward}(s, e) = s'$where$s' = \text{applyEvent}(s, e)$$Playback.position \leftarrow Playback.position + 1$, format: latex] | Time Travel to Point[sig: travelTo: Time â†’ State, def: $\text{travelTo}(t) = State_{restore}(\{e \in History \mid e.timestamp \leq t\})$, format: latex]
manifestations: Redux DevTools time travel[replay Redux actions with state restoration] | Event sourcing replay[rebuild system state from event log] | Video game replay systems[playback recorded game inputs] | Debugging time-travel (rr, Mozilla)[deterministic replay of program execution]

components: Stream[type: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Stream, desc: incoming event stream with variable rate] | Buffer[type: BoundedQueueâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Buffer, desc: bounded buffer for temporary storage] | Rate_{control}[type: â„• Ã— Time, notation: Rate_{control}, desc: maximum events per time unit] | Drop_{strategy}[type: Strategy, notation: Drop_{strategy}, desc: policy for dropping events when overwhelmed]
type_definitions: Strategy[def: $\text{Strategy} = \{\text{drop-oldest}, \text{drop-newest}, \text{drop-random}, \text{drop-lowest-priority}\}$, format: latex] | BoundedQueue[def: $\text{BoundedQueue}\langle T \rangle = \{q \mid |q| \leq \text{capacity}\}$, format: latex] | Rate[def: $\text{Rate} = \frac{\text{events}}{\text{second}} \in \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$, format: latex]
properties: P.P114.1:Buffer Boundedness[spec: $\forall t : |Buffer(t)| \leq \text{capacity}$ (no unbounded growth), format: latex] | P.P114.2:Rate Limiting[spec: $\forall \Delta t : |\{e \in \text{processed} \mid e.timestamp \in [t, t + \Delta t]\}| \leq Rate_{control} \times \Delta t$, format: latex] | P.P114.3:Backpressure Signal[spec: $|Buffer| > \theta \times \text{capacity} \implies \text{signal}(\text{upstream}, \text{slow\_down})$, format: latex] | P.P114.4:Fairness (when drop-random)[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in Buffer : P(\text{drop}(e_1)) = P(\text{drop}(e_2))$ (uniform probability), format: latex]
operations: Enqueue with Backpressure[sig: enqueue: Event Ã— Buffer â†’ (Buffer, Signal), def: $\text{enqueue}(e, b) = (b', s)$where$(b', s) = \begin{cases} (b \oplus [e], \text{ok}) & \text{if } |b| < \text{capacity} \\ (\text{drop}(b, Drop_{strategy}) \oplus [e], \text{backpressure}) & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$, format: latex] | Apply Drop Strategy[sig: drop: Buffer Ã— Strategy â†’ Buffer, def: $\text{drop}(b, s) = b'$where$b' = \begin{cases} \text{tail}(b) & \text{if } s = \text{drop-oldest} \\ \text{init}(b) & \text{if } s = \text{drop-newest} \\ b \setminus \{\text{random}(b)\} & \text{if } s = \text{drop-random} \end{cases}$, format: latex] | Throttle Stream[sig: throttle: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Rate â†’ StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, def: $\text{throttle}(S, r) = S'$where$S'(t) = \begin{cases} S(t) & \text{if } \text{rate}(t) \leq r \\ \text{None} & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Reactive Streams backpressure[RxJS, Project Reactor throttling] | Kafka consumer backpressure[consumer group lag management] | TCP flow control[sliding window protocol for backpressure] | AG-UI event throttling[managing high-frequency agent events in UI]

components: State[type: ApplicationState, notation: State, desc: current application state] | Event_{stream}[type: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Event_{stream}, desc: incoming event stream triggering updates] | Reducer[type: State Ã— Event â†’ State, notation: Reducer, desc: pure function computing state transitions] | UI_{sync}[type: State â†’ Effect, notation: UI_{sync}, desc: synchronizes UI with state changes]
type_definitions: ApplicationState[def: $\text{State} = \text{Map}(\text{Key}, \text{Value})$ (immutable state tree), format: latex] | Reducer[def: $\text{Reducer}: (S, E) \to S$ (pure, deterministic function), format: latex] | Effect[def: $\text{Effect} = \text{IO}()$ (side-effectful operation), format: latex]
properties: P.P115.1:State Immutability[spec: $\forall e \in Events : Reducer(s, e) = s' \land s \neq s'$ (no mutation, new state returned), format: latex] | P.P115.2:Reducer Determinism[spec: $\forall s, e : Reducer(s, e) = Reducer(s, e)$ (same input â†’ same output), format: latex] | P.P115.3:Event Sourcing[spec: $State_t = \text{foldl}(Reducer, State_0, \{e \in Event_{stream} \mid e.timestamp \leq t\})$, format: latex] | P.P115.4:UI Consistency[spec: $\forall s : UI_{sync}(s) \implies \text{rendered\_state} = s$ (eventual consistency), format: latex]
operations: Process Event[sig: processEvent: State Ã— Event â†’ State, def: $\text{processEvent}(s, e) = s'$where$s' = Reducer(s, e)$$UI_{sync}(s')$(side-effect), format: latex] | Subscribe to Events[sig: subscribe: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© â†’ Subscription, def: $\text{subscribe}(stream) = sub$where$\forall e \in stream : \text{processEvent}(State_{current}, e)$, format: latex] | Compute State Delta[sig: delta: State Ã— State â†’ Diff, def: $\text{delta}(s_1, s_2) = \{(k, v_2) \mid k \in \text{keys}(s_2) \land s_1[k] \neq s_2[k]\}$, format: latex]
manifestations: Redux state management[action â†’ reducer â†’ state updates] | AG-UI STATE_DELTA events[agent state changes streaming to UI] | Elm architecture[event-driven functional state updates] | React state updates from events[event handlers trigger state changes]

components: Streams[type: SetâŸ¨StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©âŸ©, notation: Streams, desc: multiple independent event streams] | Sync[type: SyncStrategy, notation: Sync, desc: time synchronization strategy for streams] | Merge[type: SetâŸ¨StreamâŸ© â†’ Stream, notation: Merge, desc: combines multiple streams into unified stream] | Display[type: Stream â†’ Visualization, notation: Display, desc: visualization of merged stream]
type_definitions: SyncStrategy[def: $\text{SyncStrategy} = \{\text{wall-clock}, \text{logical-clock}, \text{causal}, \text{vector-clock}\}$, format: latex] | MergeOperation[def: $\text{MergeOp} = \{\text{union}, \text{interleave}, \text{zip}, \text{priority}\}$, format: latex] | Timestamp[def: $\text{Timestamp} = \mathbb{N}$ (logical) or $\mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ (wall-clock), format: latex]
properties: P.P116.1:Temporal Ordering[spec: $\forall s_1, s_2 \in Streams : Merge(\{s_1, s_2\}) = s' \implies$ $\forall e_1 \in s_1, e_2 \in s_2 : e_1.ts < e_2.ts \implies \text{order}(e_1, s') < \text{order}(e_2, s')$, format: latex] | P.P116.2:Causal Consistency[spec: $\forall e_1, e_2 : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies e_1 \text{ appears before } e_2$ in merged stream, format: latex] | P.P116.3:Lossless Merge[spec: $\forall S \subseteq Streams : |\text{events}(Merge(S))| = \sum_{s \in S} |\text{events}(s)|$ (no events lost), format: latex] | P.P116.4:Real-Time Coordination[spec: $\forall s \in Streams : \Delta t_{merge}(s) < \epsilon$ (low latency merging), format: latex]
operations: Merge Streams[sig: mergeStreams: SetâŸ¨StreamâŸ© Ã— SyncStrategy â†’ Stream, def: $\text{mergeStreams}(S, sync) = s'$where$s' = \text{sortBy}(\bigcup_{s \in S} \text{events}(s), sync.\text{compare})$, format: latex] | Synchronize Clocks[sig: syncClocks: SetâŸ¨StreamâŸ© â†’ MapâŸ¨Stream, OffsetâŸ©, def: $\text{syncClocks}(S) = \{(s, \delta_s) \mid s \in S \land \delta_s = \text{clockOffset}(s)\}$, format: latex] | Interleave Streams[sig: interleave: SeqâŸ¨StreamâŸ© â†’ Stream, def: $\text{interleave}([s_1, ..., s_n]) = s$where$s = [s_1[0], s_2[0], ..., s_n[0], s_1[1], s_2[1], ...]$(round-robin), format: latex]
manifestations: Multi-agent activity dashboard[coordinated display of multiple agent streams] | Distributed tracing (Jaeger, Zipkin)[merging traces from multiple services] | Real-time collaboration (Figma, Miro)[merging action streams from multiple users] | Apache Flink stream joining[combining multiple Kafka streams]

components: Stream[type: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Stream, desc: event stream to be queried] | Filters[type: SetâŸ¨PredicateâŸ©, notation: Filters, desc: collection of filter predicates] | Query_{language}[type: QueryLanguage, notation: Query_{language}, desc: domain-specific query language for events] | Results[type: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, notation: Results, desc: filtered/queried result stream]
type_definitions: Predicate[def: $\text{Predicate} = \text{Event} \to \text{Boolean}$ (filter function), format: latex] | QueryLanguage[def: $\text{QueryLanguage} = \{\text{SQL-like}, \text{CEP}, \text{pattern-matching}, \text{temporal-logic}\}$, format: latex] | Query[def: $\text{Query} = (\text{select}, \text{where}, \text{window}, \text{aggregate})$, format: latex]
properties: P.P117.1:Filter Composability[spec: $\forall f_1, f_2 \in Filters : \text{compose}(f_1, f_2) = \lambda e. f_1(e) \land f_2(e)$ (conjunction), format: latex] | P.P117.2:Query Selectivity[spec: $\forall q \in \text{Queries} : |\text{Results}(q)| \leq |\text{Stream}|$ (filtering reduces size), format: latex] | P.P117.3:Streaming Execution[spec: $\forall e \in Stream : \text{latency}(\text{filter}(e)) < \Delta t_{threshold}$ (real-time filtering), format: latex] | P.P117.4:Pattern Matching Expressiveness[spec: $\text{Query}_{language} \supseteq \{\text{SEQ}, \text{AND}, \text{OR}, \text{NOT}, \text{WITHIN}\}$ (temporal operators), format: latex]
operations: Apply Filter[sig: applyFilter: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Predicate â†’ StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, def: $\text{applyFilter}(S, p) = \{e \in S \mid p(e) = \text{true}\}$, format: latex] | Execute Query[sig: executeQuery: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Query â†’ StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ©, def: $\text{executeQuery}(S, q) = \text{Results}$where$\text{filtered} = \{e \in S \mid q.\text{where}(e)\}$$\text{windowed} = \text{window}(\text{filtered}, q.\text{window})$$\text{Results} = q.\text{select}(\text{windowed})$, format: latex] | Pattern Match[sig: matchPattern: StreamâŸ¨EventâŸ© Ã— Pattern â†’ StreamâŸ¨MatchâŸ©, def: $\text{matchPattern}(S, pat) = \{m \mid m \text{ satisfies } pat \land m \subseteq S\}$where Pattern can be regular expression or temporal logic formula, format: latex]
manifestations: Apache Flink CEP (Complex Event Processing)[pattern matching on event streams] | Kafka Streams filtering[stream transformations with predicates] | Elasticsearch Percolator[stored queries matching incoming events] | AG-UI event filtering[filtering 16 event types by user preferences]

components: Domains[type: SetâŸ¨DomainâŸ©, notation: Domains, desc: collection of distinct business/data domains] | Data_{integrated}[type: Domain â†’ DataSet, notation: Data_{integrated}, desc: integrated data from each domain] | Relationships[type: SetâŸ¨CrossDomainLinkâŸ©, notation: Relationships, desc: relationships spanning domain boundaries] | Unified_{display}[type: Visualization, notation: Unified_{display}, desc: unified view integrating all domains]
type_definitions: Domain[def: $\text{Domain} = (\text{id}, \text{schema}, \text{agents}, \text{context})$ (bounded context), format: latex] | CrossDomainLink[def: $\text{CrossDomainLink} = (\text{source\_domain}, \text{target\_domain}, \text{mapping}, \text{translator})$, format: latex] | DataSet[def: $\text{DataSet} = \text{Set}\langle \text{Entity} \rangle$ where Entity is domain-specific, format: latex]
properties: P.P119.1:Domain Isolation[spec: $\forall d_1, d_2 \in Domains : d_1 \neq d_2 \implies d_1.\text{schema} \cap d_2.\text{schema} = \emptyset$ (separate contexts), format: latex] | P.P119.2:Integration Consistency[spec: $\forall l \in Relationships : \exists t : l.\text{translator}(Data_{integrated}(l.\text{source})) \sim Data_{integrated}(l.\text{target})$, format: latex] | P.P119.3:Context Preservation[spec: $\forall d \in Domains : \text{semantics}(Data_{integrated}(d)) = \text{semantics}_d(\text{original\_data}(d))$, format: latex] | P.P119.4:Agent Domain Assignment[spec: $\forall a \in \text{Agents} : \exists! d \in Domains : a \in d.\text{agents}$ (unique assignment), format: latex]
operations: Integrate Domains[sig: integrate: SetâŸ¨DomainâŸ© â†’ Unified_display, def: $\text{integrate}(D) = v$where$v.\text{data} = \bigcup_{d \in D} Data_{integrated}(d)$$v.\text{links} = \{l \in Relationships \mid l.\text{source}, l.\text{target} \in D\}$$v.\text{render} = \text{visualize}(v.\text{data}, v.\text{links})$, format: latex] | Translate Across Domains[sig: translate: Entity Ã— Domain Ã— Domain â†’ Entity, def: $\text{translate}(e, d_1, d_2) = e'$where$l = \text{findLink}(d_1, d_2, Relationships)$$e' = l.\text{translator}(e)$(schema mapping), format: latex] | Query Cross-Domain[sig: queryCrossDomain: Query Ã— SetâŸ¨DomainâŸ© â†’ ResultSet, def: $\text{queryCrossDomain}(q, D) = \bigcup_{d \in D} \text{execute}(q, Data_{integrated}(d))$with result unification and deduplication, format: latex]
manifestations: Enterprise data integration dashboards[unified view across CRM, ERP, Finance domains] | Multi-domain AI agent coordination[agents from different domains collaborating] | Federated search interfaces[searching across multiple domain-specific databases] | Healthcare information exchange[integrating patient data across health systems]

components: local[type: State, notation: local, desc: local state] | remote[type: State, notation: remote, desc: remote state] | diff[type: State Ã— State â†’ Delta, notation: diff, desc: computes differences] | merge[type: State Ã— Delta â†’ State, notation: merge, desc: applies changes] | conflicts[type: SequenceâŸ¨ConflictâŸ©, notation: conflicts, desc: tracks unresolved conflicts]
type_definitions: State[def: MapâŸ¨Path, ValueâŸ© // Complete state snapshot, format: latex] | Delta[def: SequenceâŸ¨ChangeâŸ© // Incremental changes, format: latex] | Conflict[def: (path: Path, local_value: Value, remote_value: Value), format: latex]
properties: P.P23.1:Eventual Consistency[spec: After quiescence: local = remote, format: latex] | P.P23.2:Conflict Resolution[spec: Concurrent changes â†’ detect conflicts â†’ resolve, format: latex] | P.P23.3:Efficient Sync[spec: Only send deltas, not full state, format: latex]
operations: Compute Delta[sig: diff(old: State, new: State) â†’ Delta, def: $diff(old: State, new: State) â†’ Delta = changes := [] for path in keys(old) âˆª keys(new): if old[path] â‰  new[path]: changes := changes ++ [Change(path, old[path], new[path])] return changes$, format: latex] | Apply Delta[sig: merge(state: State, delta: Delta) â†’ State, def: $merge(state: State, delta: Delta) â†’ State = for change in delta: if Â¬conflict(change, state): state[change.path] := change.new_value else: conflicts := conflicts ++ [Conflict(change.path, state[change.path], change.new_value)] return state$, format: latex] | Resolve Conflict[sig: resolve(conflict: Conflict, strategy: Strategy) â†’ Value, def: $resolve(conflict: Conflict, strategy: Strategy) â†’ Value = case strategy of LastWriteWins â†’ newer(conflict.local_value, conflict.remote_value) ManualResolve â†’ prompt_user(conflict) MergeValues â†’ merge_function(conflict.local_value, conflict.remote_value)$, format: latex] | Polling[sig: , def: Every Ï„ seconds: fetch remote, diff, merge Simple but wasteful, format: latex] | WebSocket[sig: , def: Persistent connection, push updates Real-time, efficient, format: latex] | Operational Transformation[sig: , def: Transform operations to account for concurrent edits Complex but powerful, format: latex]

operations: Produce[sig: produce() â†’ Effect, def: $produce() â†’ Effect = while state = flowing: chunk := producer.generate() if chunk = EndOfStream: state := ended consumer.close() else: buffer := enqueue(buffer, chunk) if buffer.size â‰¥ highWaterMark: state := paused producer.pause()$, format: latex] | Consume[sig: consume() â†’ Effect, def: $consume() â†’ Effect = while Â¬empty(buffer): chunk := dequeue(buffer) consumer.consume(chunk) if buffer.size < lowWaterMark âˆ§ state = paused: state := flowing producer.resume()$, format: latex] | Readable Stream[sig: , def: Data source (file, network) Can only read from, format: latex] | Writable Stream[sig: , def: Data sink (file, response) Can only write to, format: latex] | Transform Stream[sig: , def: Readable + Writable Transforms data in flight Example: compression, encryption, format: latex] | Duplex Stream[sig: , def: Independent readable and writable Example: WebSocket, format: latex]

Recycled DOM: Reuse DOM nodes for different items Reduces GC pressure 4. Intersection Observer: Use native API for visibility detection Better performance than scroll events, format: latex]
